citation.article-title: Thermococcus hydrothermalis sp. nov., a new hyperthermophilic archaeon isolated from a deep-sea hydrothermal vent.

p.s: Description of Thermococcus hydrothermalis sp. nov.
Thermococcus hydrothermalis (hy.dro.ther.mal'is. N.L. adj. hydrothermalis, pertaining to a hydrothermal vent)
Cells are cocci (diameter, 0.8 to 2 μm) that are motile by means of polar flagella.
Grows optimally in the presence of 30 to 40 g of Sea Salt per liter and at a pH around 6.
Growth occurs at 55 to lOO°C, and the optimum temperature is around 85°C.
Grows preferentially on proteolysis products, a mixture of amino acids, and maltose.
Sulfur is not necessary for growth but greatly enhances growth.
The results of 16s rRNA sequence comparisons place Thermococcus hydrothermalis in the Thermococcales.

Type strain AL662 (=CNCMI1319 [Collection Nationale de Cultures de Microorganismes, Institut Pasteur, Paris, France]) was isolated from an active chimney wall fragment recovered from a hydrothermal site on the East Pacific Rise at a latitude of 21°N.
